description: Construct a new accessible lookout structure that provides visitors with a destination to see some of the culturally significant views that PEI National Park has to offer. The project includes an elevated boardwalk that leads to a viewing platform, nodes that offer a place to rest and offer interpretation, a trail to safely access the boardwalk, and some other upgrades to the parking lot and surrounding area to make the offer accessible. Details of this project include: construction of a new accessible lookout structure, construction of two accessible viewing/ rest nodes, construction of a gravel path north of the existing parking area, installation of paver stones to transition the parking lot to the new lookout, modification of the parking lot spaces to make the lookout more accessible, and other site-specific upgrades. The estimated value of the project is between $500,001 and $1,000,000.  Work is to be completed by March 29, 2024.
full_summary:
# Stage 1 - Oceanview Lookout Upgrades, Cavendish, Prince Edward Island National Park
## Solicitation Details

* Reference Number: cb-96-1815270
* Amendment Number: 4
* Solicitation Number: 5P468-23-0200/A
* Publication Date: 2023-10-11
* Tender Closing Date: 2023-10-19T13:00:00
* Amendment Date: 2023-10-19
* Expected Contract Start Date: None
* Expected Contract End Date: None

## Project Overview
Parks Canada requires the construction of a new accessible lookout structure and associated upgrades at Cavendish, Prince Edward Island National Park. The project includes an elevated boardwalk, accessible viewing and rest nodes, a gravel path, paver stone installation, and parking lot modifications.

## Tender Requirements

* The successful bidder will provide all labor, materials, and equipment necessary for the construction of the lookout structure.
* The bidder must demonstrate expertise in building construction, specifically in accessible design.
* The project must be completed by March 29, 2024.
* The estimated project value is between $500,001 and $1,000,000, inclusive of taxes.

## Tender Instructions
This is a two-stage selection process. Interested bidders must submit a qualification package in Stage One, which will be evaluated based on the bidder's qualifications and experience. Stage Two bidders will be invited to submit a financial bid on the project.

## Contact Information
Questions related to the tender must be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority, Sheldon Lalonde at sheldon.lalonde@pc.gc.ca.

## Additional Information
* Bidders must obtain the tender package from the Government Electronic Tendering Service at http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities.
* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. **Note:** While Parks Canada has made every effort to provide equivalent documents in both official languages, any discrepancies between the English and French documents should be reported to the Contracting Authority. 


I hope this helps. Please let me know if you need any further adjustments.  Best regards.
